***** Hindi[edit] *****
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * (Delhi Hindi) IPA(key): /t͡ʃɑː/, [t͡ʃäː]
**** Noun[edit] ****
चा • (cā) m (Urdu spelling چا‎)
   1. Alternative form of चाय (cāy)
*** Declension[edit] ***
This noun needs an inflection-table_template.
***** Newar[edit] *****
**** Etymology[edit] ****
From Classical_Newar 𑐔𑐵 (cā), perhaps from Proto-Sino-Tibetan *s-r(j)ak.
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): [t͡ɕa]
**** Noun[edit] ****
चा • (cā) ? (Newa Spelling 𑐔𑐵)
   1. night
***** Rajasthani[edit] *****
**** Etymology 1[edit] ****
From Classical_Persian چا‎ (čā). Ultimately from Sinitic 茶 (chá).
*** Noun[edit] ***
चा (cā) ?
   1. tea
   2. cha
   3. chai
**** Etymology 2[edit] ****
Inherited from Sanskrit इच्छा (icchā).
*** Noun[edit] ***
चा (cā) ?
   1. desire
**** References[edit] ****
    * Bhanwar Lal Suthar and Sukhveer Singh Gahlot (1998), Rajasthani-Hindi-
      English Dictionary, page 101. Jodhpur: Bharat Printers (Press).
